meanings.sent1: The rainy weather made the outdoor picnic unsuit for today.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a swimsuit to a formal event would be unsuit attire.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite unsuit to wear a winter coat in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter was unsuit for the solemn occasion.
meanings.sent5: The bright pink walls were unsuit for a calming atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The new policy will unsuit many employees who rely on flexible hours.
meanings.sent2: Adding sugar to the savory dish will unsuit the taste.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit a square peg into a round hole will only unsuit the situation.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions unsuit him for the role of team leader.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain will unsuit the ground for planting seeds.
